data.text:
@Liannabelle88 @theReal_ColinB If you read the regulations they all say revoked under each one. 

Then check for the indoor mask mandate exceptions: 
When not engaging in an act precluding use in  sex clubs and bath houses. 
Also, If you’re rehearsing for a performance.  I am an actress now.

@iofthetygr02 @myrphyslawcbc @Liannabelle88 @kahnkidz @fordnation It depends on the school board I guess then. It truly begs the question of how our government could allow these types of health restrictions to be instituted by a fricking school board.
Talk about incompetence.

@myrphyslawcbc @Liannabelle88 @kahnkidz @fordnation I questioned this long ago, and the only response I got was that the school board chose to do mandatory masking. This info has been on the site for months. It also says you don’t need an exemption and are not to be hassled for it.

@Karriskatch I did see that, someone sent it! I'm just confused why CTV would report it but the Ont gov't wouldn't update their site to reflect the new "end date" (which we know won't be.. They'll extend it again)
@Liannabelle88 Here I found something. March 28th it looks like. https://t.co/Y67hzUnpEB
@LauraRosenCohen 🤔 Thank you! This just confuses me, more. If they'd chosen the 28th, why have the gov't website show Mar 1st. Then again, they've been trying to confuse us for 2 years.

@jess_traviss It's okay! I was confused by it, emergency on top of emergency on top of emergency on every level of government. The reopening Ontario act replaced the emergency act and was set to expire Mar 1st.
@Liannabelle88 Oh well then I apologize and don't know. Thought they were the same bullshit.
